creditline: Gift of Christopher Monkhouse and Catherine Futter in honor of Leo and Doris Hodroff
text: This teapot probably lost its original porcelain spout in transit.  Objects with such repairs such as this are often called make-dos. They illustrate the extent to which even broken pieces of Chinese Export were highly prized, that they would be custom-fitted with silver rather than discarded.
title: Make-do teapot
